author: peanutjuice
content:
just wondering if anyone has encountered bosses like this and what they did?

i am in tech, my boss (40+M) is a foreigner. this is his first job here in singapore and hes been working for this company for 3 years. im in a team of 10 ppl, everyone is basically sick of him but doesnt want to speak up (because 5 of then r holding ep and dont wanna go back to their country)

i just started this job, like 3 months in. im not going to be super specific about what happened but basically my team were suppose to come up with a financial report but he told us not to focus on it because a few of the project got halted. so we just went home and suddenly 10pm he started spamming teams "why is this report not finished!!! i need to present this to cfo tmr!! do you consider my instructions low priority or what?" and then he quit the chat. but he didnt only quit that chat, he quit every single group chat he has with the team, on teams and whatsapp. idk its my 2nd job only and im kinda dumbfounded... my previous supervisor in my 1st job was great and i really regret leaving my previous company for like 20% pay bump 

some other things my current supervisor has said:
- (fyi we wfh fridays company policy) he doesnt like it if we wfh fridays, and gets sarcastic whenever someone mc on monday because its a "4 day holiday" for them (fri, sat, sun, mon)
- rejected a team member's leave because it was after his reservist (he was also super unhappy he went to reservist)
- i feel like i can elaborate more but im afraid of getting found out... 

ya anyway anyone has experience with this? im just 2 years into the working world and 3 months into my 2nd job... was thinking of telling hr about it because im going to resign soon because hes the reason why im ending my probation. company is good, office has nice environment and my team members are great but my boss is really... idk how to even describe sia lol

comments.author: cyke69sg

All the more they won't bother.

I know it is difficult to accept. But the reality is you are a junior member of the staff. Replaceable. 
The sooner you accept that the more free you will be.
Take it with stride. Boss angry with the team. Not you specifically. In fact I would say you should see this as an opportunity to step up to the fore and help your boss.
Especially in situations where there is crunch deadline rush job. Work harder. Burn you weekend to get the report to your boss. Rally the troops.

Your boss see you do it for him you win some loyalty and favor. Then you rise up the ranks.

I have been in your situation before. In fact when I hear the boss is very tough and crazy to please I see it as a challenge. Butter up the boss. Not just with words. Coffee. Help. Loyalty. You will be rewarded later.

Sounds like your team of 10 ppl extremely passive and meek. Maybe that's why your boss is so fed up. Should fire the whole lot!

I dunno but it sounds like all your team members are more the slacker kind. No motivation. No ambition. Not driven.  Thinking more of WFH and leave.
I am strongly against WFH as I believe it is shake leg at home do no work and is a holiday for staff pretty much. WFH is GARBAGE 




 This is just an inkling of what the real world is. I dunno what your first job was but you're going to realize this is the norm.

It's highly competitive. Want to get ahead got to do more not less. 
To earn extraordinary income you need to be extraordinary. Make sense? 
See problems as challenges and opportunity.
Become the go to guy that fixes problems. Rescues last minute rush jobs and jobs going to miss the deadline. Be the CLUTCH team member. Machiam like Michael Jordan Kobe Bryant Cristiano Ronaldo the one they turn to when the team need to pull off a result.

Why not have that mentality? After all its the work and tasks that matter. Why focus on boss reactions and behavior? If he ask nicely would it be better? Maybe but maybe not. 

Focus on what you can do. Not what someone else is behaving. 

That's my advice to you.
